marketNews.title: Banking Business Orientation Survey 3Q24 Shows Liquidity Risks Remain Stable
marketNews.content: A business orientation survey of banks for the third quarter of 2024 conducted by the Financial Services Authority (OJK) indicates that liquidity risk remains well‑maintained and is expected to improve compared with the previous quarter, driven by expectations that bank liquidity tools will grow. Previously, OJK recorded that banking liquidity began to tighten with the loan‑to‑deposit ratio (LDR) reaching 86.51 percent in July 2024, the highest level since August 2020.

marketNews.title: Transport Minister Targets 10% Airfare Reduction by October 2024
marketNews.content: The Minister of Transportation, Budi Karya Sumadi, said that the government aims to reduce airline ticket fares by ten percent starting in October 2024. Budi explained that the fare reduction can be achieved if two proposals from his side – a tax relief on aircraft spare parts and the de‑monopolisation of aviation fuel supply – are implemented in the near future.

marketNews.title: Legislator Discusses Ministry Bill to Remove Limit on Number of Ministries
marketNews.content: Deputy Chairman of the DPR Legislative Body, Achmad Baidowi, said that the Ministry Bill will eliminate the cap on the number of ministries. The bill also contains provisions related to the splitting or merging of agencies within ministries, allowing the president to adjust institutional needs. Baidowi noted that the majority of political party factions in the Legislative Body have approved the changes and that the Ministry Bill will soon be brought to the plenary session of the DPR.

marketNews.title: CNBC Indonesia Reports Upcoming Fuel Subsidy Restrictions for Vehicles
marketNews.content: CNBC Indonesia reported that the upcoming fuel subsidy restriction policy being prepared by the government will prohibit gasoline‑powered cars with engine capacity above 1,400 cc from using Pertalite. In addition, the policy will ban diesel‑powered cars with engine capacity above 2,000 cc from using subsidised solar fuel. The vehicle eligibility criteria for subsidised fuel will be regulated in a ministerial regulation by the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, although the official details have not yet been announced. The fuel subsidy restriction is targeted to take effect on 1 October 2024.

marketNews.title: US Federal Reserve Reports Consumer Credit Rise of $25.45 Billion in July 2024
marketNews.content: The US central bank, the Federal Reserve, recorded that consumer credit in the United States increased by 25.45 billion dollars in July 2024 compared with June 2024, surpassing consensus expectations of a 12.5 billion dollar increase and marking the highest rise since November 2022.

tickerNews.title: TPMA Forms New Joint Venture, Potential Net Profit Increase up to +15%
tickerNews.content: Trans Power Marine (TPMA) announced a cooperation with PT Samudra Investama Maju to establish a joint venture named PT Trans Ocean Permata (TOP) that will operate in coal transportation and logistics services in South Sumatra. TPMA explained that TOP has an initial capital of 20 billion rupiah, with the company holding a 51 percent ownership. Within the next two to three years, TOP plans to acquire 20 tugboats and barges and two floating cranes with a capital expenditure of 90 million US dollars. The expansion will be financed 20 percent by internal cash and the remaining 80 percent through bank loans. This is not TPMA's first expansion via joint venture. Previously, in 2021 the company formed a joint venture called PT Trans Logistik Perkasa (TLP) together with T&J Industrial Holding Limited (TJI), an entity of Tsingshan Holding Group, and Pacific Pelayaran Indonesia. TLP was created to transport Tsingshan nickel output in Maluku. The company had 41 tugboats and barges as of the first half of 2024, with a target fleet of 60 tugboats and barges by 2025. Key Takeaway: The formation of this joint venture could become a growth catalyst for TPMA's financial performance. Based on our conservative estimate, TOP could generate revenue of 4.9 to 10.9 million US dollars in its first year of operation, equivalent to 5.4 to 12.1 percent of our FY24 forecast for TPMA's post‑consolidation revenue with PT Bahtera Energi Samudra Tuah (BEST). We also estimate TOP's first‑year net profit at 752.6 thousand to 1.7 million US dollars, representing 2.7 to 6 percent of our FY24 net profit forecast for TPMA. Assumptions used: - Acquisition of 20 tugboats and barges and 2 floating cranes over a three‑year period. - Revenue per tugboat/barge assumed at 1.1 billion rupiah per month, based on TLP's lowest per‑asset revenue among TPMA and BEST. - Revenue per floating crane assumed at 7 billion rupiah per month, matching TPMA's floating crane per‑asset revenue. - Net profit margin assumed at 30 percent, after reducing non‑controlling interest by 49 percent. If TOP completes the full fleet acquisition, we estimate TPMA's revenue and net profit could increase by 26.8 million and 4.1 million US dollars respectively, equivalent to 29.5 percent and 14.7 percent of our FY24 revenue and net profit forecasts for TPMA.

tickerNews.title: GMFI Announces Rights Issue to Acquire Rp418.3 Billion of Assets from GIAA
tickerNews.content: Garuda Maintenance Facility Aero Asia (GMFI) plans to conduct a rights issue of up to 11.7 billion new shares, resulting in a dilution effect of up to 29.36 percent. The issue price and ratio have not been disclosed, and the proceeds will be used for working capital. GMFI's controlling shareholder, Garuda Indonesia (GIAA), will exercise its full rights by contributing assets valued at a total of 418.3 billion rupiah, consisting of three hangars, annexes, and supporting facilities at Soekarno‑Hatta Airport. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 16 October 2024.

tickerNews.title: MIDI Reports Same Store Sales Growth of +12.01% YoY in August 2024
tickerNews.content: Midi Utama Indonesia (MIDI) recorded same‑store sales growth (SSSG) of plus 12.01 percent year‑on‑year in August 2024, compared with 9.64 percent YoY in the first half of 2024, surpassing the management's 2024 guidance of plus 8 percent YoY. Management targets SSSG of around plus 11 percent YoY for the third quarter of 2024. MIDI also reported that the company opened 36 new Alfamidi stores in July‑August 2024, bringing the total new stores during the first eight months of 2024 to 111 units, equivalent to 55.5 percent of the 2024 target of 200 new stores.

tickerNews.title: DSSA Subsidiary Wins Geothermal Lease for Two 40 MW Sites
tickerNews.content: Bisnis reported that Dian Swastatika Sentosa's geothermal subsidiary, PT Daya Anugerah Sejati Utama, won a tender for two geothermal work areas, located in Cisolok Cisukarame, West Java and Nage, East Nusa Tenggara. Each area is planned to host a 40 MW geothermal power plant. However, the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has not yet announced the official winners, and DSSA declined to comment on the news.

tickerNews.title: WIKA Pays Maturity on PUB II Phase I Bonds and Sukuk
tickerNews.content: Wijaya Karya (WIKA) announced that the company has made the scheduled principal payment for the Sustainable Public Offering (PUB) II Phase I bonds and sukuk amounting to 896 billion rupiah. Managing Director Agung Budi Waskito stated that the payment complies with the agreement between the company and bond and sukuk holders. In addition to the principal repayment, WIKA also paid interest on the PUB II Phase I bonds and sukuk totaling 55.06 billion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: PORT Announces Tender Offer for Up to 726 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: The new controlling shareholder of Nusantara Pelabuhan Handal, China Merchants International Port‑Integrated Development (Hong Kong) Company Limited, announced a mandatory tender offer for up to approximately 726 million shares (25.8 percent) of PORT at a price of 818 rupiah per share from 3 September to 2 October 2024. The price is 15.2 percent lower than PORT's closing price on Tuesday, 10 September. This corporate action follows China Merchants International Port‑Integrated Development's acquisition of a 51 percent stake in PORT in June 2024.

tickerNews.title: AKRA Shareholder PT Arthakencana Rayatama Increases Stake to 63.05%
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder of AKR Corporindo, PT Arthakencana Rayatama, purchased 32.1 million AKRA shares at an average price of 1,433.9 rupiah per share between 4 and 6 September 2024. The total transaction value reached 46 billion rupiah. After the transaction, PT Arthakencana Rayatama's ownership in AKRA rose from 62.89 percent to 63.05 percent.

tickerNews.title: BCAP Clarifies No Acquisition Offer for Vista Outdoor
tickerNews.content: MNC Kapital Indonesia (BCAP) refuted reports from several national media outlets that the company had submitted an offer to acquire Vista Outdoor (NYSE: VSTO). BCAP explained that the acquisition proposal was made by MNC Capital Partners, L.P., a Montreal‑based firm, and is not part of, nor affiliated with, the MNC Group.

tickerNews.title: KKGI Director Wimpi Salim Sells 869,099 Shares
tickerNews.content: The director of Resource Alam Indonesia (KKGI), Wimpi Salim, sold 869,099 KKGI shares at an average price of 590 rupiah per share on 6 September 2024. The total transaction value amounted to 512.8 million rupiah. After the sale, Wimpi Salim's ownership in KKGI decreased from 0.02 percent to 0 percent.
